Segment base class desription¶

class segments.segments_base.segment_single(name, segment_type='render')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class defining single segments for one sequence. This is at the moment rather basic. Here should be added more fuctions.

add_IQ_ref_channel(channel_name, pointer_to_channel, I_or_Q_part)[source]¶

Add a reference to an IQ channel. Same principle as for the virtual one. Args:

channel_name (str): human readable name of the virtual channel pointer_to_channel (*segment_single_IQ): pointer to segment_single_IQ object I_or_Q_part (str) : ‘I’ or ‘Q’ to indicate that the reference is to the I or Q part of the signal.
add_block()[source]¶
add_np()[source]¶
add_pulse()[source]¶
add_ramp()[source]¶
add_reference_channel(channel_name, segment_data, multiplication_factor)[source]¶

Add channel reference, this can be done to make by making a pointer to another segment. Args:

Channels_name (str): human readable name of the virtual gate. segment_data (segment_single): pointer so the segment corresponsing the the channel name multiplication_factor (float64): times how much this segment should be added to the current one.
add_sin()[source]¶
append()[source]¶
get_segment(index, pre_delay=0, post_delay=0, sample_rate=1000000000.0)[source]¶
input:
index of segment (list) : which segment to render (e.g. [0] if dimension is 1 or [2,5,10] if dimension is 3) pre_delay : number of points to push before the sequence post delay: number of points to push after the sequence. sample rate : #/s (number of samples per second)
Returns:
A numpy array that contains the points for each ns points is the expected lenght.
integrate(index, pre_delay=0, post_delay=0, sample_rate=1000000000.0)[source]¶

get integral value of the waveform (e.g. to calculate an automatic compensation) Args:

index (tuple) : index of the concerning waveform pre_delay (double) : ns to delay before the pulse post_delay (double) : ns to delay after the pulse sample_rate (double) : rate at which to render the pulse

returns: intergral value

last_edit¶
plot_segment(index=[0], render_full=True)[source]¶
Args:
index : index of which segment to plot render full (bool) : do full render (e.g. also get data form virtual channels). Put True if you want to see the waveshape send to the AWG.
pulse_data_all¶

pulse data object that contains the counted op data of all the reference channels (e.g. IQ and virtual gates).
